docs.lead_paragraph: In most places, adding vitamins and minerals to food is considered a good idea, but not in Denmark, a view that is causing friction in an era of common markets.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than any other city in America, Aspen, Colo., has embraced a nationwide pro-veggie effort aimed at persuading people to go meatless at least one day a week.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mark Vaccacio, a lanky guitar player from Yonkers who spent most of his adult life as either John Lennon or George Harrison in tribute bands playing in ''Beatlemania'' on Broadway, at Shea Stadium and in Caribbean bars and party boats, died on Wednesday. His hope of making it to age 60 was denied 13 months early. The cause of death was the terminal colon cancer that surgery could not eliminate last year, his daughter, Christina, said.

headline.main: There Will Be No More Yesterdays for a Perpetual Beatle

docs.abstract: City Room blog pays homage to Mark Vaccacio, who has died; Vacccio spent most of his adult life playing in Beatles tribute bands; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Lapham’s Quarterly has put together a graphic showing how many calories a dollar will buy in various forms, including lettuce, canned tuna, a bottle of Coca-Cola and a McDouble sandwich at McDonald’s. It’s a good illustration of one of the problems with the American diet: unhealthy food is often a lot cheaper than healthy food.

headline.main: A Look at How Many Calories $1 Will Buy

docs.abstract: A chart shows how many calories a dollar will buy, through different foods and beverages.

docs.lead_paragraph: HASHIM--George. The entire St. Luke's-Roosevelt Hospital Center family acknowledges with sadness the passing of George Hashim, beloved brother of our dear friend and colleague, Sami Hashim, MD, a longtime member of our medical staff in the Division of Endocrinology, Diabetes and Nutrition. To Sami, the entire Hashim family and his brother's loved ones, we extend heartfelt condolences. Frank J. Cracolici President Oscar Garfein, MD President Medical Board Bruce Polsky, MD Chairman of Medicine Xavier Pi-Sunyer, MD Chief, Endocrinology, Diabetes and Nutrition
